sn48.48:4.2: “Mendicants, how many faculties must a mendicant develop and cultivate so that they can declare enlightenment:
sn48.48:4.3: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence”’?”
sn48.48:5.1: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”
sn48.48:5.2: “A mendicant must develop and cultivate five faculties so that they can declare enlightenment.
sn48.48:5.5: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi, and wisdom.
sn48.48:5.6: These are the five faculties that a mendicant must develop and cultivate so that they can declare enlightenment:
sn48.48:5.7: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’”
